Description: Fungal infection is overgrowth of fungi on skin, nails, or mucous membranes, causing itching, redness, scaling, and sometimes blistering.
Allergy is an immune system hypersensitivity to normally harmless substances, resulting in symptoms such as sneezing, itching, rash, and in severe cases, anaphylaxis.
GERD is a chronic digestive disorder where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing heartburn, regurgitation, and potential esophageal damage.
Chronic cholestasis is impaired bile flow from the liver over time, leading to bile acid buildup, jaundice, pruritus, and fat-soluble vitamin malabsorption.
Drug reaction refers to any adverse response to a medication, ranging from mild allergic rashes to severe anaphylaxis or organ toxicity.
Peptic ulcer disease involves open sores in the stomach or duodenal lining caused by acid and Helicobacter pylori, presenting with burning epigastric pain and potential bleeding.
AIDS is the late stage of HIV infection marked by severe immune system damage, leading to life-threatening opportunistic infections and cancers.

Diabetes mellitus is a group of metabolic disorders characterized by chronic hyperglycemia due to impaired insulin secretion or action, leading to polyuria, polydipsia, polyphagia, and long-term vascular complications.
Gastroenteritis is inflammation of the stomach and intestines due to infection, leading to diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and dehydration.
Bronchial Asthma is a chronic inflammatory airway disease characterized by bronchoconstriction, wheezing, cough, and shortness of breath in response to triggers.
Hypertension is persistently elevated arterial blood pressure that strains the heart and vessels, increasing risk of heart attack, stroke, and kidney damage.
Migraine is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent moderate to severe throbbing headache, often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light or sound.
Cervical spondylosis is age-related degeneration of cervical spine discs and joints, causing neck pain, stiffness, and potential nerve compression leading to radiating symptoms.
Paralysis from brain hemorrhage occurs when intracerebral bleeding damages motor pathways, resulting in sudden loss of movement or weakness on one side of the body.
Jaundice is yellowing of the skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin levels, indicating underlying liver dysfunction or hemolysis.
Malaria is a mosquito-transmitted parasitic infection by Plasmodium species, causing cyclical fevers, chills, anemia, and potential organ complications if untreated.
Chicken pox is a highly contagious viral infection caused by varicella-zoster virus, characterized by an itchy vesicular rash and fever.
Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection caused by dengue virus, presenting with high fever, severe headache, muscle and joint pain, and risk of hemorrhagic manifestations.
Typhoid fever, caused by Salmonella typhi, is an enteric bacterial infection characterized by sustained high fever, abdominal pain, headache, and occasional rose-colored rash.
Hepatitis A is an acute viral infection of the liver transmitted via the fecal-oral route, causing jaundice, nausea, abdominal pain, and elevated liver enzymes.
Hepatitis B is a blood-borne viral infection of the liver that can present acutely or chronically, leading to jaundice, fatigue, and risk of cirrhosis or hepatocellular carcinoma.
Hepatitis C is a blood-transmitted viral infection that often becomes chronic, causing liver inflammation, fibrosis, and increased risk of cirrhosis and liver cancer.
Hepatitis D is a defective RNA virus requiring hepatitis B for replication, resulting in more severe liver inflammation and accelerated disease progression.
Hepatitis E is an acute, fecal-oral transmitted viral liver infection, typically self-limited but severe in pregnant women, causing jaundice and flu-like symptoms.
Alcoholic hepatitis is liver inflammation caused by excessive alcohol consumption, presenting with jaundice, hepatomegaly, fever, and elevated liver enzymes.
Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection by Mycobacterium tuberculosis that primarily affects the lungs, causing persistent cough, fever, night sweats, and weight loss.
The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, primarily caused by rhinoviruses, leading to sneezing, nasal congestion, sore throat, and cough.
Pneumonia is an infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs, causing cough, fever, chest pain, and difficulty breathing.
Dimorphic hemorrhoids (piles) refers to swollen and inflamed veins in the lower rectum and anus, causing pain, itching, bleeding, and discomfort exacerbated by straining.
Heart attack (myocardial infarction) occurs when blood flow to heart muscle is blocked, causing chest pain, shortness of breath, and potential heart damage.
Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins resulting from valve dysfunction, leading to leg pain, swelling, and a heavy sensation.
Hypothyroidism is underactive thyroid gland resulting in low thyroid hormone levels, leading to fatigue, weight gain, and cold intolerance.
Hyperthyroidism is overactive thyroid gland causing excess thyroid hormone production, resulting in weight loss, rapid heartbeat, and nervousness.
Hypoglycemia is abnormally low blood glucose levels, leading to trembling, sweating, confusion, and in severe cases, seizures or loss of consciousness.
Osteoarthristis is a degenerative joint disease where cartilage breakdown leads to joint pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility, commonly affecting the knees, hips, and hands.
Arthritis is inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
(Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo is a vestibular disorder where displaced inner ear crystals cause brief episodes of intense dizziness triggered by head movements.
Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
Urinary tract infection is an infection of any part of the urinary system, most commonly the bladder, causing dysuria, frequency, urgency, and possible lower abdominal pain.
Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by red, itchy, and scaly patches.
Impetigo is a highly contagious skin infection causing red sores that can break open.
